Title: About Us | Authentic Sunnah Healing & Qualified Hakeems
Meta Description: Learn about Al Madina Hijama Center's mission to revive Sunnah healing in Lahore. Meet our certified therapists and Hakeems dedicated to hygiene and patient care.
Content: Who We Are: Al Madina Hijama Center is dedicated to reviving the Sunnah of Hijama by providing authentic, accessible healing to the community of Lahore. We provide exceptional care in a sterile environment to help restore balance, alleviate pain, and enhance natural vitality.
Our Mission: Guided by the prophetic tradition: "Whoever performs Hijama on the 17th, 19th or 21st of the lunar month, it is a cure, by Allah's permission." We offer dedicated male therapists for men and female therapists for women, along with convenient home services to ensure a comfortable experience for every client.
Our Vision: To be the most trusted Hijama center in Lahore, deeply rooted in prophetic wisdom. We are committed to observing the preferred Sunnah dates (17th, 19th, 21st of the lunar month) for maximum benefit.
Our Core Commitments:
Sunnah-Based Healing: Deeply rooted in Prophetic traditions for a spiritually fulfilling experience.
Uncompromising Hygiene: Adherence to the highest cleanliness standards using sterile, single-use equipment.
Personalized Patient Care: Treatment plans tailored to unique health needs.
Years of Experience: Over 15 years in alternative medicine.
Meet Our Team of Experts:
1. Mr. Jameel ur Rehman (Founder & Hijama Therapist)
Qualifications: Certified Hijama Specialist from Oman, Tib E Nabvi Hakeem in Pakistan.
Experience: 15+ years.
Specialty: Treating brain/nervous system disorders (migraine, stress), heart, liver, and digestive problems using Sunnah-based traditions.
2. Hakeem Muhammad Atif Ali Aqasha
Licensing: Officially licensed by the National Council for Tibb (NCT), Government of Pakistan (Reg. No. QH-37741-A).
Qualifications:
Fazil-ut-Tibb-Wal-Jarahat (FTJ) - 4-year diploma from Razi Tibbia College.
Diploma in Muhammadin System of Shafa (M.D.S.S).
Specialization in Tibb-e-Nabvi (Prophetic Medicine).
Expertise: Provides personalized, holistic consultations based on traditional Tibb and Islamic knowledge.

Title: Contact & FAQs | Al Madina Hijama Center
Content: Contact Channels:

Phone/WhatsApp: +92 300 7598000
Email: info@almadinahijamacenter.com
Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ):
Q: What is Hijama (Cupping Therapy)? A: A traditional therapeutic method involving suction on the skin using cups to draw out stagnant, toxic blood. It detoxifies the body.
Q: Is the procedure painful? A: Generally, no. Most clients experience only a slight pinching sensation or minor scratches.
Q: How long does a session take? A: Typically 30 to 45 minutes.
Q: Is the equipment sterile? A: Absolutely. We adhere to strict hygiene standards. All cups and surgical blades are single-use and disposable.
Q: Do you offer home services? A: Yes, we provide professional Hijama services at your home in Lahore.

Confidentiality: Health information is treated with utmost confidentiality.
No Selling: We do not sell, rent, or trade personal data to third parties.

Brightens Complexion: Removes dullness for an immediate healthy glow.
Smooths Texture: Helps clear blemishes and soften old acne scars.

Indications: Dull/tired skin, fine lines, puffy face. Contraindications: Active acne, sunburn, recent Botox (3 weeks), pregnancy. Pricing: Rs. 300 per cup.

Content: Overview: A specialized, non-invasive therapy for managing benign breast cysts (Gilti) and promoting lymphatic drainage. Performed strictly by certified female practitioners in a private setting.
Safety:
Requirement: Medical diagnosis confirming cysts are benign is mandatory.
How It Works: Targets specific points around the breast tissue (never directly on the cyst) to pull stagnant fluid towards lymph nodes.
Key Benefits: Relieves discomfort, reduces inflammation, promotes drainage, and supports natural shrinkage.
Contraindications: Undiagnosed lumps, history of breast cancer (without clearance), menstruation, pregnancy.

URL: https://www.almadinahijamacenter.com/blog/dry-cupping-vs-wet-cupping-hijama-lahore
Title: Dry Cupping vs Wet Cupping (Hijama): Which is Better?
Meta Description: What is the difference between Dry Cupping (muscle relaxation) and Wet Cupping (Hijama, deep detox)?
Content: Dry Cupping:
Technique: Suction only (no cuts).
Goal: Muscle relaxation, pain relief, blood flow.
Best For: Back pain, stiff neck, fatigue.
Wet Cupping (Hijama):
Technique: Suction + Micro-incisions + Extraction.
Goal: Deep detoxification, removing stagnant blood.
Best For: Chronic illness, migraines, high BP, hormones.
Pain Level: Dry is painless; Wet feels like a light scratch. Marks: Both leave temporary circular marks (3-7 days).

URL: https://www.google.com/search?q=https://www.almadinahijamacenter.com/blog/what-is-hijama-benefits-lahore
Title: What is Hijama? History, Benefits, and Best Cupping Therapy
Meta Description: Discover the healing power of Hijama (Cupping Therapy). Learn about its Sunnah history and benefits for pain/fertility.
Content: Definition: Arabic hajm ("sucking"). Uses suction to draw out stagnant/bad blood. A deep detox.
History:
Global: Used by Egyptians (1550 BC) and the Chinese.
Sunnah: Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) called it "The Best Cure" and used it for headaches/poisoning.
Procedure:
Suction: Vacuum draws old blood to the surface.
Scratch: Tiny, feather-light incisions.
Extraction: Toxic blood removed.
Benefits: Detoxification, Pain Relief (Endorphins), Women's Health (Fertility), Hair Loss (Alopecia). Safety: Zero-tolerance policy for unsafe practices; strictly single-use equipment.
------------------------------------------------------------------
